name: UpdateIncidentCustomField
description:
Update a custom field for a specific incident type.

Use this tool to update custom fields for incident types, providing additional context and support for filtering and analytics. Custom field options can be modified in the same call.

parameters.name: incident_type_identifier
parameters.description: The ID or name of the specific incident type to update the custom field for.

value_schema.description: The ID or name of the Incident Type.

parameters.name: field_identifier
parameters.description: Provide the unique ID of the field to be updated for the incident type.

parameters.name: accept_header_version
parameters.description: Specifies the version of the API to be used through the Accept header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type_header
parameters.description: Set the content type to specify the media type of the request body. Use 'application/json'.

parameters.name: custom_field_details
parameters.description: JSON object specifying details of the custom field: display_name, enabled status, default_value, description, and field_options.

display_name.description: The display name of the Incident Type.

enabled.description: Whether the Incident Type is enabled.

default_value.description: The default value of the custom field.

description.description: The description of the custom field.

field_options.description: List of options to upsert on the custom field. Can only be applied to fields with a `field_type` of `single_value_fixed` or `multi_value_fixed`. When an `id` property is included, this will update the value of the specified field option. Without an `id` property, that field option will be added to the field. Any existing field options not included in the upsert list will be deleted (unless the current default value refers to a field option to be deleted).

field.description: Details of the custom field to be updated.
